meanings.definition: In a manner that fulfills one's obligations or responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: She completed her chores dutifully every day.
meanings.sent2: The student followed the teacher's instructions dutifully.
meanings.sent3: The dog dutifully fetched the newspaper every morning.
meanings.sent4: The sun rose dutifully each day, bringing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked dutifully, marking the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: The dutiful soldier followed orders without question.
meanings.sent2: She gave a dutiful nod to show her agreement.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a dutiful meow when asked to come inside.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood dutifully in the corner of the garden, providing shade.
meanings.sent5: The painting hung dutifully on the wall, adding color to the room.
